intro: Anodendron pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered anodendron, is a small shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces small, elliptical fruits that contain a single seed. Anodendron pauciflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
